nodes.name: Plato
nodes.description: Classical Greek philosopher, student of Socrates, and founder of the Academy in Athens. His works on philosophy, politics, knowledge, and ethics are foundational to Western thought.

nodes.name: Aristotle
nodes.description: Ancient Greek philosopher and polymath who studied under Plato. His works cover physics, metaphysics, ethics, politics, and more, forming the foundation of Western philosophical and scientific thought.

nodes.name: Socrates
nodes.description: Classical Greek philosopher credited as the founder of Western philosophy. Known primarily through the accounts of his students, particularly Plato.

nodes.name: René Descartes
nodes.description: French philosopher, mathematician, and scientist. Often called the father of modern Western philosophy, his work remains influential in mathematics and philosophy.
contributions: Cogito, ergo sum ('I think, therefore I am')

nodes.name: Immanuel Kant
nodes.description: German philosopher who is a central figure in modern philosophy. His comprehensive system of transcendental idealism reconciled rationalism and empiricism.

nodes.name: David Hume
nodes.description: Scottish Enlightenment philosopher, historian, economist, and essayist. Best known for his empiricism and skepticism.

nodes.name: John Locke
nodes.description: English philosopher and physician, widely regarded as one of the most influential of Enlightenment thinkers. Considered the father of classical liberalism.
contributions: Tabula rasa (blank slate) theory of mind

nodes.name: Baruch Spinoza
nodes.description: Dutch philosopher of Portuguese Sephardi origin. One of the early thinkers of the Enlightenment and modern biblical criticism.

nodes.name: Friedrich Nietzsche
nodes.description: German philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, and philologist whose work has exerted a profound influence on modern intellectual history.

nodes.name: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
nodes.description: German philosopher who was a major figure in German idealism. His historicist and idealist account of reality revolutionized European philosophy.

nodes.name: Thomas Aquinas
nodes.description: Italian Dominican friar, philosopher, and theologian. An immensely influential philosopher, theologian, and jurist in the tradition of scholasticism.
contributions: Synthesis of Aristotelian philosophy with Christianity

nodes.name: Ludwig Wittgenstein
nodes.description: Austrian-British philosopher who worked primarily in logic, the philosophy of mathematics, the philosophy of mind, and the philosophy of language.

nodes.name: Jean-Paul Sartre
nodes.description: French philosopher, playwright, novelist, screenwriter, political activist, biographer, and literary critic. A key figure in existentialism and phenomenology.

nodes.name: Simone de Beauvoir
nodes.description: French writer, intellectual, existentialist philosopher, political activist, feminist, and social theorist. A major figure in modern feminist philosophy.

nodes.name: Bertrand Russell
nodes.description: British philosopher, logician, mathematician, historian, writer, social critic, political activist, and Nobel laureate. A founder of analytic philosophy.

nodes.name: Epicurus
nodes.description: Ancient Greek philosopher and founder of the school of philosophy called Epicureanism. Only fragments and secondary sources remain from his teachings.
contributions: Critique of superstition and divine intervention

nodes.name: Diogenes of Sinope
nodes.description: Ancient Greek philosopher and one of the founders of Cynicism. Famous for his simple lifestyle and criticism of conventional social values.

nodes.name: Cicero
nodes.description: Roman statesman, lawyer, scholar, philosopher and Academic Skeptic who played an important role in the politics of the late Roman Republic.
contributions: Transmission of Greek philosophy to Romans

nodes.name: Seneca the Younger
nodes.description: Roman Stoic philosopher, statesman, dramatist, and humorist. One of Rome's leading intellectual figures in the mid-1st century CE.

nodes.name: Xenophon
nodes.description: Ancient Greek historian, philosopher, soldier, mercenary, and student of Socrates. Known for his writings on the history of his own times and Socratic dialogues.

nodes.name: Heraclitus
nodes.description: Pre-Socratic Greek philosopher known for his doctrine of change being central to the universe and for the famous saying 'No man ever steps in the same river twice.'
